name: Desert Spine and Sports Physicians

primary: Adults (ages 35–75) with pain, injuries, or mobility issues

brand_mission: Empower patients to live healthy, active lives through innovative, non-surgical care that restores function. We focus on treating the whole person using personalized, non-surgical treatments designed to relieve pain and restore movement. Our team of board-certified, fellowship-trained specialists are dedicated to helping patients avoid chronic pain and return to fully functional, more active lives.

do: Speak to function and quality of life, not just pain
Use terms like relief, restore, rebuild, recover, active lifestyle, non-surgical healing
Highlight minimally invasive or regenerative treatments such as PRP and BMAC
Refer to DSSP as a trusted provider, patient-first practice, or innovator in non-surgical spine care
donot: Do not use the word 'sciatica' — say 'lumbar radiculopathy' instead
Do not describe pain as 'minor' or 'mild' — use 'non-severe' or 'not functionally limiting'
Do not reference surgery — DSSP only provides non-surgical care
Do not refer to DSSP as a 'pain management center' — use 'pain treatment center'
Do not use 'needles' or 'body parts' in text or image prompts
Do not focus on 'reducing swelling' — this is not part of their messaging

clinical_strengths: Exclusive focus on non-surgical treatments for spine and musculoskeletal conditions
Offers cutting-edge procedures including PRP therapy, BMAC therapy, prolotherapy, and Intracept
Uses fluoroscopic and ultrasound-guided techniques for precision and safety
All physicians are board-certified and fellowship-trained in Physical Medicine & Rehabilitation (PM&R)
Provides advanced, minimally invasive options like kyphoplasty (but not vertebroplasty)
Specialized in both common and complex pain conditions including lumbar radiculopathy, osteoarthritis, and disc degeneration
philosophical_strengths: Delivers whole-person care that treats the individual, not just the symptom
Prioritizes restoring function and improving quality of life, not just relieving pain
Personalizes every treatment plan to meet the patient's unique needs and lifestyle
Focuses on preventing chronic or recurring pain through regenerative medicine and education
Demonstrates warmth, compassion, and a true partnership in care
organizational_strengths: Operates under a 'privademics' model — combining academic-level rigor with the efficiency of private practice
Recognized as a Top Docs provider, enhancing brand trust and authority
Offers a NASS-recognized fellowship program to train the next generation of physiatrists
Maintains a transparent, ethical, and supportive team culture
Supports partner physicians with infrastructure, administrative resources, and growth opportunities while maintaining clinical autonomy

topic_targeting: Tailor to selected topic (e.g., PRP = healing tissue, not just inflammation)
procedure_language: Use precise terms like 'fluoroscopically guided PRP' instead of 'PRP shot'
Mention restoring function, reducing pain, and returning to activity

location_references.Scottsdale: 8670 E. Shea Blvd., Suite 102, Scottsdale, AZ 85260
